We operate sectors oil natural gas service industry: directional drilling services; compressed air drilling services; casing tubing services; rental tools; production services. Providing high-quality, technologically advanced services equipment central operating strategy. As result commitment customer service, developed strong relationships leading oil natural gas companies, including independents majors. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> Our growth strategy focused identifying pursuing opportunities markets growing faster oilfield services industry capitalize competitive strengths. Over past years, significantly expanded geographic scope operations range services provide internal growth strategic acquisitions. Our organic growth primarily achieved expanding geographic scope, acquiring complementary equipment, hiring personnel service regions cross-selling products services existing operating locations. Since 2001, completed 14 acquisitions, including 2005 2006. The coil tubing units range size 1<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">1</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">4</FONT><FONT face="symbol">&#178;</FONT> 1<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">3</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">4</FONT><FONT face="symbol">&#178;</FONT>. We provide chemicals injected well. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Cyclical Nature Of Equipment Rental And Services Industry</FONT></U></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> The oil natural gas equipment rental services industry highly cyclical. The critical factor assessing outlook industry worldwide supply demand oil domestic supply demand natural gas. The peaks valleys demand cyclical industries. This primarily result industry driven commodity demand price increases. As demand increases, producers raise prices. The price escalation enables producers increase capital expenditures. The increased capital expenditures ultimately result greater revenues profits services equipment companies. The increased capital expenditures ultimately result greater production historically resulted increased supplies reduced prices. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> Demand services strong 2003, 2004 2005. Management believes demand remain strong 2006 due high oil natural gas prices capital expenditure plans exploration production companies. Because market fundamentals natural gas, management believes long-term trend activity markets favorable. However, factors offset developments affecting worldwide supply demand oil natural gas products. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <BR> 10 </DIV><!-- END LOGICAL --> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL --> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Customers</FONT></U></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> In 2005, customers accounted 10% revenues. font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> In 1999 2000, Board compensated continuing Board members served 1989 March&#160;31, 1999 compensation issuing promissory notes totaling $325,000 granting stock options individuals. Options purchase 4,800&#160;shares common stock granted exercise price $13.75. These options vested immediately expire March 2010. As December&#160;31, 2005, options exercised. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> On May&#160;31, 2001, Board granted directors, Leonard Toboroff, option purchase 100,000&#160;shares common stock $2.50&#160;per share, expiring October 2011. The option granted services provided Mr.&#160;Toboroff OilQuip prior merger OilQuip Rentals, Inc., including providing financial advisory services, assisting OilQuip&#146;s capital structure assisting OilQuip finding strategic acquisition opportunities. None options exercised. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> In February 2001, issued warrants purchase 233,000&#160;shares common stock exercise price $0.75&#160;per share warrants purchase 67,000&#160;shares common stock exercise price $5.00&#160;per share connection subordinated debt financing. The warrants purchase 233,000&#160;shares redeemed December 2004 $1.5&#160;million. The remaining 67,000 warrants outstanding expire February 2011. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> In connection private placement April&#160;2004, issued warrants purchase 800,000&#160;shares common stock exercise price $2.50 share. A total 486,557 warrants exercised 2005. </TD> <TD> &nbsp; </TD> <TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom"> $ </TD> <TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom"> 2.78 </TD> <TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom"> &nbsp; </TD> </TR> </TABLE> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Segments Enterprise Related Information</FONT></U></I></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> We disclose results segments accordance SFAS&#160;No.&#160;131, <I>Disclosures About Segments Of An Enterprise And Related Information </I>(&#147;SFAS&#160;No.&#160;131&#148;). We designate internal organization management allocating resources assessing performance source reportable segments. SFAS&#160;No.&#160;131 requires disclosures products services, geographic areas major customers Please Note&#160;18 disclosure segment information accordance SFAS&#160;No.&#160;131. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Pension Other Post Retirement Benefits</FONT></U></I></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> SFAS&#160;No.&#160;132, <I>Employer&#146;s Disclosures About Pension And Other Post Retirement Benefits </I>(&#147;SFAS&#160;No.&#160;132&#148;), requires disclosures employers&#146; pension post retirement benefit plans specifies accounting measurement recognition plans. SFAS&#160;No.&#160;132 requires disclosure information benefit obligations fair values plan assets facilitates financial analysis. Please Note&#160;3 disclosure accordance SFAS&#160;No.&#160;132. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Income Per Common Share</FONT></U></I></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> We compute income common share accordance provisions SFAS&#160;No.&#160;128, <I>Earnings Per Share </I>(&#147;SFAS&#160;No.&#160;128&#148;). SFAS&#160;No.&#160;128 requires companies complex capital structures present basic diluted earnings share. Basic earnings share computed basis weighted average number shares common stock outstanding period. For periods April&#160;12, 2004, preferred dividends deducted net income considered calculation income common stockholders computing basic earnings share. Diluted earnings share similar basic earnings share, presents dilutive effect share basis potential common shares (e.g., convertible preferred stock, stock options, etc.) converted. Potential dilutive common shares anti-dilutive effect (e.g., increase income share) excluded diluted earnings share. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; </TD> <TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000"> &nbsp; </TD> <TD> &nbsp; </TD> <TD> &nbsp; </TD> <TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000"> &nbsp; </TD> <TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000"> &nbsp; </TD> <TD> &nbsp; </TD> </TR> </TABLE> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Reclassification</FONT></U></I></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> Certain prior period balances reclassified conform current year presentation. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><I><U><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">New Accounting Pronouncements</FONT></U></I></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> In May 2005, FASB issued SFAS&#160;No.&#160;154, <I>Accounting Changes Error Corrections.</I> SFAS&#160;No.&#160;154 requires retroactive application voluntary change accounting principle prior period financial statements impracticable. SFAS&#160;No.&#160;154 requires change method depreciation, amortization depletion long-lived, non-financial assets accounted change accounting estimate affected change accounting principle. SFAS&#160;No.&#160;154 replaces APB Opinion No.&#160;20, &#147;Accounting Changes&#148; SFAS&#160;No.&#160;3, &#147;Reporting Accounting Changes Interim Financial Statements&#148;. SFAS&#160;No.&#160;154 effective fiscal years beginning December&#160;15, 2005. We adopt provisions SFAS&#160;No.&#160;154 January&#160;1, 2006 expect adoption material impact results operations financial condition. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> In December 2004, FASB issued SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123R, <I>Share-Based Payment.</I> SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123R revises SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123, <I>Accounting Stock-Based Compensation</I>, focuses accounting share-based payments services employer employee. The statement requires share-based payments employees, including grants employee stock options, recognized financial statements based fair values. We adopt SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123R January&#160;1, 2006 modified prospective transition method, utilizing Black-Scholes option pricing model calculation fair employee stock options. Under modified prospective method, stock option awards granted, modified settled January&#160;1, 2006 measured accounted accordance SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123R. However February 2005, determined transaction accounted purchase accounting pursuant SFAS&#160;No.&#160;141, <I>Business Combinations </I>and recorded sale interest subsidiary, accordance SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin&#160;No. 51, <I>Accounting Sales Stock Subsidiary.</I> Consequently, restated financial statements quarter ended September&#160;30, 2003, year ended December&#160;31, 2003 quarters ended September&#160;30, 2004, reflect adjustments: </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Increase Book Value Fixed Assets.</FONT></I> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> Under joint venture accounting, originally recorded assets contributed M-I AirComp M-I&#146;s historical cost $6.9&#160;million. Under purchase accounting, increased recorded assets contributed M-I approximately $3.3&#160;million $10.3&#160;million reflect fair market determined party appraisal. In addition, joint venture accounting, established negative goodwill reduced fixed assets amount $1.6&#160;million. The negative goodwill amortized lives related fixed assets. Under purchase accounting, increased fixed assets $1.6&#160;million reverse negative goodwill previously recorded reversed amortization expenses recorded 2004. Therefore, cost fixed assets increased total $4.9&#160;million time acquisition. As result increase fixed assets reversal amortization negative goodwill, depreciation expense increased $98,000 year ended December&#160;31, 2003. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Increase Minority Interest Capital Excess Par Value.</FONT></I> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> Under purchase accounting, minority interest increased $1.5&#160;million, partially offset minority interest expense $44,000 year ended December&#160;31, 2003. margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.33</B> </DIV> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>STOCK PURCHASE AGREEMENT</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Stock Purchase Agreement (&#147;Agreement&#148;) made December&nbsp;20, 2005, <B>Allis-Chalmers Energy Inc.</B>, Delaware corporation (&#147;Buyer&#148;) <B>Joe Van Matre</B>, individual resident Lafayette, Louisiana (&#147;Seller&#148;). </DIV> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>R E C T A L S</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Seller desires sell, Buyer desires purchase, issued outstanding shares (&#147;Shares&#148;) capital stock Specialty Rental Tools Inc., Louisiana corporation (&#147;Company&#148;), consideration terms set Agreement. </DIV> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>AGREEMENT</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The parties, intending legally bound, agree follows: </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>1. </B><U><B>DEFINITIONS</B></U> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes Agreement, terms meanings referred Section&nbsp;1: </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Applicable Contract&#148;</B></U>&#151;any Contract (a)&nbsp;under Company acquire rights, (b)&nbsp;under Company subject obligation liability, (c)&nbsp;by Company assets owned bound. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Balance Sheet&#148;</B></U>&#151;as defined Section&nbsp;3.4. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Best Efforts&#148;</B></U>&#151;the efforts prudent Person desirous achieving result similar circumstances ensure result achieved expeditiously possible; <U>provided, however,</U> obligation Best Efforts Agreement require Person subject obligation actions result materially adverse change benefits Person Agreement Contemplated Transactions. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Breach&#148;</B></U>&#151;a &#147;Breach&#148; representation, warranty, covenant, obligation, provision Agreement instrument delivered pursuant Agreement deemed occurred (a)&nbsp;any inaccuracy breach of, failure perform comply with, representation, warranty, covenant, obligation, provision, (b)&nbsp;any valid claim (by Person) occurrence circumstance inconsistent representation, warranty, covenant, obligation, provision, term &#147;Breach&#148; means inaccuracy, breach, failure, claim, occurrence, circumstance. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">1 </DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Code&#148;</B></U>&#151;the Internal Revenue Code 1986, amended. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Company&#148;</B></U>&#151;as defined Recitals Agreement. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Consent&#148;</B></U>&#151;any approval, consent, ratification, waiver, authorization (including Governmental Authorization). </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Contemplated Transactions&#148;</B></U>&#151;all transactions contemplated Agreement, including: </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) performance Buyer Seller respective covenants obligations Agreement; </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Contract&#148;</B></U>&#151;any agreement, contract, obligation, promise, undertaking (whether written oral express implied) legally binding. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Contribution&#148;</B></U>&#151;as defined Section&nbsp;2.7. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Damages&#148;</B></U>&#151;as defined Section&nbsp;10.2. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Disclosure Letter&#148;</B></U>&#151;the disclosure letter delivered Seller Buyer concurrently execution delivery Agreement. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Employment Agreement&#148;</B></U>&#151;as defined Section&nbsp;2.4(a)(iii). </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Encumbrance&#148;</B></U>&#151;any charge, claim, community property interest, condition, equitable interest, lien, option, pledge, security interest, refusal, restriction kind, including restriction use, voting, transfer, receipt income, exercise attribute ownership. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">2 </DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Environment&#148;</B></U>&#151;soil, land surface subsurface strata, surface waters (including navigable waters, ocean waters, streams, ponds, drainage basins, wetlands), groundwaters, drinking water supply, stream sediments, ambient air (including indoor air), plant animal life, environmental medium natural resource. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 3%"><U><B>&#147;Environmental, Health, Safety Liabilities&#148;</B></U>&#151;any cost, damages, expense, liability, obligation, responsibility arising Environmental Law Occupational Safety Health Law consisting relating to: </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 9%">(a)&nbsp;any environmental, health, safety matters conditions (including on-site off-site contamination, occupational safety health, regulation chemical substances products);
